Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Flirt \Flirt\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Flirted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Flirting}.] [Cf. AS. fleard trifle, folly, fleardian to trifle.] 1. To throw with a jerk or quick effort; to fling suddenly; as, they flirt water in each other's faces; he flirted a glove, or a handkerchief. [1913 Webster]
2. To toss or throw about; to move playfully to and fro; as, to flirt a fan. [1913 Webster]
3. To jeer at; to treat with contempt; to mock. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
I am ashamed; I am scorned; I am flirted. --Beau. & Fl. [1913 Webster]
flirting n : playful behavior intended to arouse sexual interest [syn: {flirt}, {flirtation}, {coquetry}, {dalliance}, {toying}]
